# Welcome to Doc Studio
Welcome to your new documentation workspace! Doc Studio is a Confluence-like documentation tool built natively for Odoo.
## Features
- **Rich Editor**: Use the visual WYSIWYG editor with slash commands - **AI Assistance**: Press `/` and select AI to generate content - **Workspaces**: Organize documentation by project or team - **Tags**: Categorize pages for easy filtering - **Markdown Backend**: All content stored as Markdown for Git versioning
## Getting Started
1. Create a new page using the "New Page" button 2. Use the editor to write your documentation 3. Try the AI assistant by typing `/` and selecting "AI" 4. Organize pages into workspaces and add tags
## Navigation
Use the sidebar to navigate between pages. Pages can be nested for hierarchical organization.
Happy documenting! üìù

# Quick Start Guide
This guide will help you get up and running with Doc Studio in minutes.
## Step 1: Create Your First Page
Click the **New Page** button in the top bar to create a new documentation page.
## Step 2: Edit Content
1. Click the **Edit** button to enter edit mode 2. Use the WYSIWYG editor to write your content 3. Try slash commands by typing `/` for quick formatting
## Step 3: Use AI Assistance
1. In edit mode, type `/` to open the command menu 2. Select **AI** from the options 3. Describe what you want to write 4. The AI will generate content for you
## Step 4: Organize Your Documentation
- Assign pages to **Workspaces** for team-based organization - Add **Tags** to categorize content - Create **nested pages** by setting parent pages
## Tips
- Use the ‚≠ê button to favorite important pages - Link between pages using `[Page Name](doc://id)` syntax - Your content is automatically saved as Markdown

# API Reference
This is the API reference documentation for our product.
## Endpoints
| Method | Endpoint | Description | |--------|----------|-------------| | GET | `/api/docs` | List all documents | | POST | `/api/docs` | Create a document | | GET | `/api/docs/{id}` | Get document details | | PUT | `/api/docs/{id}` | Update a document | | DELETE | `/api/docs/{id}` | Delete a document |
## Authentication
All API requests require an API key in the header:
``` Authorization: Bearer your-api-key ```
## Example Request
```python import requests
response = requests.get( 'https://api.example.com/api/docs', headers={'Authorization': 'Bearer your-api-key'} ) print(response.json()) ```
## Rate Limits
- 1000 requests per hour - 10 concurrent connections
